PlantForm: Perennial creeping or scrambling mat-forming herb.
Size: Up to 70 cm tall, more when climbing.
Stem: Low running stems with upright flower stalks.
Leaves: Glossy, dark green above, paler underside, 4-18 cm long, lance shaped with usually 3-lobes and toothed edges. In pairs along stem.
Flowers: Yellow to orangeish typical daisy with straplike petals in circle, 2 cm diameter on short stalks above leaves.
Habitat: Gardens, parks, drainage channels, roadsides, urban bushland, footpaths.
DistinguishingFeatures: Quite distinctive. Growth habit and leaves combination.
